snippet: “Navigators,” created under the new health care law to educate consumers about health insurance options, are seen as crucial to the success of the law.
abstract: So-called 'navigators' are a new class of workers created under health care reform law to educate consumers about new health insurance options and to walk them through the enrollment process; navigators are seen as crucial to the success of the law, but as the effort gets under way across the country, it is clear that their impact will vary from state to state, depending on whether states have embraced the law or not.
lead_paragraph: “Navigators,” created under the new health care law to educate consumers about health insurance options, are seen as crucial to the success of the law.

headline.main: The Challenge of Helping the Uninsured Find Coverage
headline.print_headline: The Challenge Of Helping The Uninsured Find Coverage
